title: Daily Evening Bhagavatam Discourse | HH Stoka Krishna Swami | SB 1.16.7-8 | 13-01-2023
speaker: HH Stoka Krishna Swami

segments.key_quote: All of us desire freedom from death, especially those who are devotees.
segments.summary: The speaker introduces the 7th verse of the 16th chapter of the 1st canto of Srimad Bhagavatam, explaining the desire for freedom from death and attaining eternal life through devotion.

segments.key_quote: Modern scientists, they do not know the real self, the spirit. They think only in terms of the body.
segments.summary: The speaker elaborates on Srila Prabhupada's purport, criticizing modern science's attempts to avoid death through physical means, emphasizing the importance of the spirit soul over the perishable body.

segments.key_quote: The only hope of suspending the cruel slaughtering process of Yamaraj is to call him to hear and chant the holy name of the Lord.
segments.summary: The speaker explains that chanting the holy name of the Lord and engaging in devotional service is the only way to avoid death and transcend material existence.

segments.key_quote: As long as Yamarāja, who causes everyone's death, is present here, no one shall meet with death.
segments.summary: The speaker discusses the 8th verse, explaining that hearing the transcendental pastimes of the Lord protects one from death and leads to eternal life in Krishna's abode.

segments.key_quote: The surest remedy for avoiding death is to accustom oneself to hearing the nectarean pastimes of the Lord as they are systematically narrated in the text of Śrīmad-Bhāgavatam.
segments.summary: The speaker emphasizes the importance of hearing Srimad Bhagavatam daily to conquer death, highlighting the distinction between the perishable body and the eternal soul.

segments.key_quote: When he sees that we are eager to hear Kṛṣṇa kathā in the Bhāgavatam, then he cleanses our desire for material enjoyment.
segments.summary: The speaker explains how hearing Bhagavatam purifies the heart and removes desires for material enjoyment through Krishna's mercy, mentioning the three important incarnations in Kali Yuga: Chaitanya Mahaprabhu, Srimad Bhagavatam, and the Hare Krishna mantra.

segments.key_quote: The purpose of this body is simply to engage in devotional service to Kṛṣṇa and thereby become free from all desires for extending our material existence into another material body after quitting this body.
segments.summary: The speaker concludes by reiterating the importance of hearing Bhagavatam, chanting Hare Krishna, and accepting Prasadam to purify oneself, realize one's spiritual identity, and ultimately return to Godhead.
